revised_title: Address Delivered by Earl of Rosse on the State of Science and the Contributions of Professor Owen
tldr: In this address, the Earl of Rosse highlights the steady progress of science and the significant contributions of Professor Owen in the fields of comparative anatomy, physiology, and zoology. Owen's work includes cataloging John Hunter's anatomical collection, studying the mammary glands of the Ornithorhynchus paradoxus, and researching marsupial animals' generation and development.
